nodes.bodyText: this one is not required, but just added it as a small enhancement
@strkkk , please move this in separate commit, "minor: refactor ....." to keep it off javadoc beutification

Why 2 instances of the same check? Really we just lost the setting of private when we changed the default value for the scope.
Also, default scope is already private. It was the Missing method which was the issue.
https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/javadoc/JavadocMethodCheck.java#L375
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -551,6 +551,11 @@
     <module name="JavadocMethod">
       <property name="validateThrows" value="true"/>
     </module>
+    <module name="JavadocMethod">
+      <property name="id" value="privateMethodsJavadoc"/>

@@ -551,6 +551,11 @@
     <module name="JavadocMethod">
       <property name="validateThrows" value="true"/>
     </module>
+    <module name="JavadocMethod">
+      <property name="id" value="privateMethodsJavadoc"/>

@@ -565,6 +570,11 @@
     <module name="MissingJavadocMethod">
       <property name="allowMissingPropertyJavadoc" value="true"/>
     </module>
+    <module name="MissingJavadocMethod">
+      <property name="id" value="missingPrivateMethodsJavadoc"/>
+      <property name="allowMissingPropertyJavadoc" value="true"/>
+      <property name="scope" value="private"/>

nodes.bodyText: Here we need a second instance since check can accept only one scope. Default is public, so one more instance of check is added with same properties but different scope
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -565,6 +570,11 @@
     <module name="MissingJavadocMethod">
       <property name="allowMissingPropertyJavadoc" value="true"/>
     </module>
+    <module name="MissingJavadocMethod">
+      <property name="id" value="missingPrivateMethodsJavadoc"/>
+      <property name="allowMissingPropertyJavadoc" value="true"/>
+      <property name="scope" value="private"/>

nodes.bodyText:
private should already include public. Only 1 scope should be needed in this case.
https://checkstyle.org/property_types.html#Scope

Using a specific scope means not only will that modifier be examined, but also all the modifiers listed above it in the previous list. Specifying public means only items with public modifiers are checked. Specifying protected means only public and protected modifiers are checked.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -565,6 +570,11 @@
     <module name="MissingJavadocMethod">
       <property name="allowMissingPropertyJavadoc" value="true"/>
     </module>
+    <module name="MissingJavadocMethod">
+      <property name="id" value="missingPrivateMethodsJavadoc"/>
+      <property name="allowMissingPropertyJavadoc" value="true"/>
+      <property name="scope" value="private"/>

nodes.bodyText: I didn't know that. I have made changes
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -565,6 +570,11 @@
     <module name="MissingJavadocMethod">
       <property name="allowMissingPropertyJavadoc" value="true"/>
     </module>
+    <module name="MissingJavadocMethod">
+      <property name="id" value="missingPrivateMethodsJavadoc"/>
+      <property name="allowMissingPropertyJavadoc" value="true"/>
+      <property name="scope" value="private"/>
